Corpus

public Corpus(java.lang.String featurePath,
              java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> volumeLabels,
              Vocabulary vocabulary,
              FeatureNormalizer normalizer)
A constructor that we use to create one-volume corpora when a model has already been trained and we're cycling through the test set one volume at a time

Parameters:
featurePath - Directory in which the source file is contained.
volumeLabels - An ArrayList of length one, containing the filename for the volume to be loaded in this corpus, minus ".pg.tsv", which will be added back in the readVolumes method.
vocabulary - The vocabulary used to select features.
normalizer - Stores feature means and stdevs for normalization.

Corpus

public Corpus(java.lang.String rootPath,
              java.lang.String dirtyHtid,
              Vocabulary vocabulary,
              FeatureNormalizer normalizer)
A constructor that we use to create one-volume corpora when a model has already been trained and we're cycling through the test set. This version differs from the one above by extracting the volume from a pairtree structure. It also expects to receive a *dirty* HathiTrust pairtree id.

Parameters:
rootPath - Root of the pairtree file structure.
dirtyHtid - The HathiTrust ID (including any slashes and colons) that specifies a pairtree path. Note that the ID gets cleaned when used as a label in the Volume object, so it can be used as a filename later.
vocabulary - The vocabulary used to select features.
normalizer - Stores feature means and stdevs for normalization.
pairtree - A generic pairtree object to invoke. In truth this could be a static class.

Corpus

public Corpus(java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> filelines,
              java.lang.String dirtyID,
              Vocabulary vocabulary,
              FeatureNormalizer normalizer)
A constructor that we use to minimize i/o in cases where the same volume is going to be passed through multiple models. Instead of accepting a filepath, it accepts the already-read lines of the file.

Parameters:
filelines - The raw text of the underlying volume feature file, as a list of strings.
vocabulary - The vocabulary used to select features.
normalizer - Stores feature means and stdevs for normalization.

getFirstVolID

public java.lang.String getFirstVolID()
This is relevant mainly to one-volume corpora; it returns the volume ID for the first volume in the list.
